title: Distortions

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Yune "visited" again, huh? Did she have anything interesting to say?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sort of. I think she might be responsible for the ancient flood that sank all of the other continents.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Sorry to break up your alone time, you two, but we have Disciples of Order troubles again.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Hey! That's--

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I knew this would happen, eventually.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: What is it, Empress Sanaki? Oh, I see.

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Ah, my dear Sanaki, the false apostle! What a pleasure to see you again, and this time, I've an army of the righteous behind me, ready to strike you down!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Vice-Minister Lekain. You are the foulest kind of traitor. I can never forgive you!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Ha ha... How amusing. Forgiveness from a fraud is of no value to anyone.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Empress, please don't force me to listen to his blasphemies any longer! All me to silence him for you!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Hold, Sigrun. I want to understand. Lekain, on what grounds do you claim that I am not the true apostle?

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: The apostle of Begnion shall be the firstborn daughter of each generation in the line of Altina, first empress. She will give voice to the goddess. She will pass judgment, give prophecy, and protect her people and their lands. Sanaki, you have never once heard the voice of the goddess, have you?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: That is... That is only because... I have not come of age yet!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Oh, what a hysterical coincidence! That's just what the senate has been telling the people for years now! "Apostle Sanaki is too young to hear the goddess. Give her more time." How funny that the lie you've been living is the same lie we've been telling.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: But, how... Explain yourself, Lekain!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Poor false apostle... No one ever told you about your older sister, did they? She was the true apostle.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I...had a sister?

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: She died before you were born, assassinated along with Apostle Misaha by the heron clan. So the senate installed you, the second daughter, as the apostle instead.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: You lie! You impugn both me and the noble herons!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Heh heh heh... I'm glad to have exposed your secret. Perhaps now you will be able to accept the truth.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Silence! The lying tongue of a treacherous senator proves nothing!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: You seek proof? Fine. We shall settle this in the ancient way: in a battle to the death. Whomsoever the goddess sees fit to win the day must be in the right!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Lekain! We've finally found you! Now's our chance, Sothe! We must do whatever it takes to get the blood pact!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Right. Let's go!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: King Naesala. You are by yourself today?

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: Yeah. How about you? Where's that stone-faced sidekick of yours?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: He's just hesitant to show his emotions.

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: I'm only joking. Don't get so defensive.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Then don't insult my family.

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: Hmph. You say he's your brother, but there's as much resemblance between you two as between me and Skrimir.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: We're not related, but we're very close. Perhaps like you and Princess Leanne.

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: What?! You didn't--

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes, I can sense your emotions. I also know that you just closed up to keep me from looking in.

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: You possess the same power as the herons? How stupid of me to let my guard down.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I'm sorry.

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: What else did you sense?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Excuse me?

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: Did you find out anything else about me?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No! I didn't try to read your mind intentionally. I just felt that your feelings for Princess Leanne were very warm, and that's all I saw.

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: You're sure? Fine. You're a lot like me. I'll let you off the hook this time.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What do you mean by that?

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: You'll see when the time comes.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: King Naesala...

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: I almost forgot. Here, this is for you.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: This is a tome of light...

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: We need you to stay alive, all right? See you later.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Naesala...

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: How did it go, Sigrun? Did you find anything useful?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Only this, unfortunately.

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Ah! It’s the tome of Bolganone! This is quite rare. Good work, Commander!

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Sigh...

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Such a heavy sigh. What’s wrong?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: What sort of state is the world in, when the apostle--our empress--has taken up arms and fights alongside the common soldiers?

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Is that still bothering you? I already told you not to worry.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: I know. But what would the duke of Persis think if he saw you right now?

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Ah, Sephiran... I wonder what he and Zelgius are doing right now?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: They’re awaiting your return, of course.

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: You don’t have any doubt about that?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Of course not. Duke Persis comes from a family of great mages. General Zelgius is the finest general in all of Begnion. They wouldn’t have been petrified. We’ll see them when we return to the empire.

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: That’s true. I’m certain that they’re safe, too. They must be waiting for us. Let us make haste toward Sienne.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Yes. That is why I keep suggesting that you should stay away from danger, and--

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Nonsense. We will fight with everything we have. And in order to fight to our utmost, we need powerful magic at our disposal! Follow me, Sigrun. Under these sands are many precious treasures. Help me find them!

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: I’m glad she is feeling better, but to see our empress is digging around in the dirt like a common farmhand... Sigh.

battle.speaker: Numida
battle.line: Vice-Minister Lekain, I take it we may begin? Champions of the goddess! Crush these heretics! Give them the reward for rebelling against our goddess!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Ugh... They're so powerful... Are we...destined to perish here?

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: My Maiden... Hold on a little longer. I am here.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Hello! How can I help?

recruit-talk.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-talk.line: What? Who--

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: You and I were born under the same fate.

recruit-talk.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-talk.line: "Same fate"? Do you also carry the mark?

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Indeed. I don’t know who you are fighting, or why. But attacking my kin in the desert is the same as attacking me. I will not let them leave this place alive.

recruit-talk.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-talk.line: My friend... May I ask your name?

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: When you ask someone’s name, isn’t it proper to give your name first?

recruit-talk.speaker: Micaiah
recruit-talk.line: S-sorry. I’m Micaiah.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: And I am Stefan. Well met. Let’s go.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: I remember you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: What a pleasure to see you again, noble dame of Gallia.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: It’s Lethe. I see that you were spared from petrification. I’m glad.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Petrification? I’d like to hear more about that, but there seems to be some sort of battle on.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: We only seem to run into each other when I’m fighting for my life. Sorry I don’t have the time to catch up.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Ah, well, that’s easily fixed. I shall help you win the battle, so we can talk properly. How does that sound?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Sounds just like old times. It’s good to fight with you again, Stefan.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Stefan! What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: That’s what I was about to ask you! I came to see what all the noise in my desert was about.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Ah, so you didn’t get turned to stone! That is very good!

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Stone? What are you talking about? I suppose you’ll have to fill me in later. Let’s fight off the enemy together.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Good! Mordecai is happy to fight with Stefan again!

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: And I as well, Mordecai.

battle-talk.speaker: Lethe
battle-talk.line: I remember you!

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: Pleasure to see you again, noble dame of Gallia.

battle-talk.speaker: Lethe
battle-talk.line: It’s Lethe. I see that you were spared from petrification. I’m glad.

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: Petrification? I’d like to hear more about that, but there seems to be some sort of battle on.

battle-talk.speaker: Lethe
battle-talk.line: We only seem to run into each other when I’m fighting for my life. Sorry I don’t have the time to catch up.

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: Ah, well, that’s easy. I've joined the battle, so we can talk properly later. How does that sound?

battle-talk.speaker: Lethe
battle-talk.line: He certainly hasn't changed.

battle-talk.speaker: Mordecai
battle-talk.line: Stefan! What are you doing here?

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: That’s what I was about to ask you! I came to see what all the noise in my desert was about.

battle-talk.speaker: Mordecai
battle-talk.line: Ah, so you didn’t get turned to stone! That is very good!

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: Stone? What are you talking about? I suppose you’ll have to fill me in later. Let’s fight off the enemy together.

battle-talk.speaker: Mordecai
battle-talk.line: Good! Mordecai is happy to fight with Stefan again!

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: And I as well, Mordecai.

battle-talk.speaker: Leanne
battle-talk.line: (By the goddess... You!)

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: You fear me? I do not blame you. I apologize for the circumstances of our last meeting. Be assured, Princess, I am not here to harm you. If you are frightened, I shall step away.

battle-talk.speaker: Leanne
battle-talk.line: (Nothing good can come of his being here. He’s a walking nightmare...)

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: I knew it. I knew that even if the end of the world came, you'd be the last one left standing.

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: Your faith is touching.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Well, you and the commander. Commander Ike will defeat you, you know. You can't run forever.

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: You are correct. We will soon meet again.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Shouldn't you sound more worried about that? You sound as if you're looking forward to fighting Commander Ike again. Don't delude yourself. You can't beat him.

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: We shall see.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Ah, Sir Knight! I am glad to see you're safe! I knew someone of your power wouldn't have turned to stone.

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: I am glad to see you're safe as well, Maiden.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Are you here to save us again?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: Not "us."

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: What?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: I am only here to save you. No one else.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: But, why? Why just me?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: We will talk more when the battle is over. I shouldn't have said anything yet. Forgive me.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Sir Knight...

boss.speaker: Numida
boss.line: What... What's happening? Vice-Minister? I lost the battle...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sir Knight! How good to see you! You always save me from danger.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Maiden. I have a favor to ask of you. Will you come with me? My master awaits you at the Tower of Guidance.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: The Tower of Guidance? If I may ask...who is your master?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: You will see when we get there. Please take my hand. We will be there in the blink of an eye.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...I can't. I can't leave everyone behind. We have to get to the tower together.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Your allies will turn to stone with the light of judgment next shines. I do not wish for you to see it.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: The light will strike again? When? Please tell me!

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: ...Maiden. I will come for you again. Make up your mind by then.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Wait...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Don't tell me, he's gone again, right? I knew we couldn't count on him.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Um, Sothe...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Lekain got away, didn't he?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yes, he did. But we'll have another chance.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I'm sure of it. I know he's going to attack us again. Don't know if that's good news or bad...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I know. We have to be ready.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Sigrun. Tanith. I need to talk to both of you.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Empress. Why so serious? Whatever it is, you can be sure that Sigrun and I will help you with it.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Tanith, let her speak.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: When the last apostle was assassinated, and I was not yet born, Begnion went a long time without central authority. The people were frightened, both of the murder and the power vacuum. Without the goddess's voice, Begnion was lost. Sephiran once told me that when the senate confirmed my appointment as the next apostle, it was as if a sign of relief sounded across the country.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: It's true. I still remember your coronation, the first time I ever saw you, Empress Sanaki. With your tiny hand in Sephiran's, you stumbled as you walked... A little girl, barely visible in the grand hallway of the cathedral. It was a moving sight.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: I remember as well. The empress stepped on her cape and tripped a total of five times.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Tanith, that hardly seems appropriate.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I think the country's sigh of relief was unwarranted. I cannot hear the goddess's voice. I never could. This has perplexed me for years. At first I thought my youth was to blame, but this excuse grows thinner each year. There is no clear age at which previous apostles heard the goddess for the first time, but all of them had heard by now.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Empress, if this is about what Duke Gaddos said--

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: If I am not the true apostle, have I betrayed my people? Even unknowingly? You two are my most trusted friends. How would you feel about me if I were not the apostle? Be honest with me.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: You would like an honest answer? Very well. It would change nothing.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: If you thought that our allegiance was to the office of the apostle, well, you were wrong. Even from a young age, you have been working with Lord Sephiran to fight the senate on behalf of the people.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Our loyalty lies with you, Empress Sanaki. You will always be our empress. Please do not forget that.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: ...I am...blessed. Not by the voice of the goddess, but by loyalty like yours.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Be strong, Empress Sanaki. Even if you are not an apostle, you are still the one, true empress of Begnion.

narration: Prince Kurthnaga tells of the connection between Daein and the dragon tribes. Ranulf reveals the identity of the Black Knight. These revelations send Ike's mind spinning in a whirlpool of confusion and doubt.

Ike becomes convinced that the answers to all of his question lie within the Tower of Guidance, and he is determined to reach the tower at any cost. His group arrives in the duchy of Tanas, near the imperial capital. Caught in a sudden downpour, they take shelter in the duke's deserted villa.
